730237f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 22nd Street - Lexington Avenue.]
730237f-a.text:
E. 28th Street, south side, east of Lexingten Avenue.
(general view northwestward,.
A roof-top view across a low structure at the S. E. corner of the above mentioned location, Iooking towards the uncompleted Empire State Building. Obscuring a better perspective are office buildings at the S. E. and N. E. corners of Fourth Avenue and E. 29th Street. The low structures in the center are furnished room houses today and are at the N. W. corner of Lexington Avenue
(right) and E. 28th Street (left).
February 22, 1931
P. L. Sperr

720916f-a.text:
9 Lexinton Svenue, at the S.E. corner of East 22nd Street, (left), showing the home of the former Mayor Abram S. Hewitt, who was the son-in-law of the beneficent Peter Cooper. His son, Erskine Hewitt, succeeded to same in turn. The photographer silhouettes same against a background of apartment dwellings that face on Gramercy Park. Note the lanterns extending from the balcony over the portico. These are reminiscent of the old New York custom indicating the residence of the chief executive. A similar feature is to be found around the corner at No. 4 Gramercy Park Aest, the home of the former Mayor Harpef of the
publishing firm of that name.
February 4, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
